data.title: Channing Frye Biography, Wife, Contract, Mother, Father & Family Facts
data.meta_description: Wildcats forward center Channing Frye, who received the prestigious University of Arizona Sapphire Award, has played professional basketball for six
data.text:
Wildcats forward center Channing Frye, who received the prestigious University of Arizona Sapphire Award, has played professional basketball for six notable teams since joining the National Basketball Association (NBA) in 2005. He has played with teams of this type; Portland Trail Blazers, Phoenix Suns, Orlando Magic, Cleveland Cavaliers and Los Angeles Lakers. Frye, who was traded to the Los Angeles Lakers from the Cavaliers in February 2018, returned to the team on July 19, 2018.

His first stint with the Cavaliers gave him the chance to win an NBA championship in 2016. Other notable awards the baller has under his belt include: McDonald’s All-American, which he won in 2001, he picked the Pac-10 All-Freshman team in 2002 and was a two-time All-Pac-10 first team in 2004 and 2005, respectively. Channing won the NBA First Team All-Star in 2006. Here are some other lesser-known facts about the NBA player.

Biography of Channing Frye

The popular basketball player was born to KarenMulzac-Frye and Thomas Fray at White Plains stations in New York City on May 17, 1983. He attended St Mary’s Phoenix High School where he was ranked No. 13 center in the nation by Fast Break Recruiting Services and no longer rookie in the country by Hoop. Scoop. After graduating from high school, the rising star went to the University of Arizona, where he was a major contributor to the Wildcats basketball team from 2001-2005. Channing was selected in the 2005 NBA draft as eighth overall by the New York Knicks.

Beyond basketball, the famous baller touched many lives through his humanitarian activities. He founded the Channing Frye Foundation in 2007. The foundation whose sole purpose is to channel young people in a healthy and positive direction was replaced in 2010 by a second foundation called the Frye Family Foundation, which he established in collaboration with his wife. The Frye Family Foundation aimed to give back to the following communities: Arizona, Portland and Oregon. Channing also took on the sponsorship of a charity kickball tournament in Portland. His personal charisma and contribution to improving the lives of the less privileged made him so popular that he was named after a dish at his favorite restaurant in Portland.

The contracts

The talented basketball player has signed several contracts since his NBA draft in 2005. His first contract was signed with his first team, the New York Knicks, in 2005. He then signed contracts with the Portland Trail Blazers, the Phoenix Suns, the Orlando Magic, Cleveland Cavaliers and Los Angeles Lakers..

Notable among them was the $3.8 million contract with a second-year option he signed with the Phoenix Suns on July 14, 2009. Channing did not accept the contract; Instead, he signed a new five-year, $5 million deal with the same team. Before his contract with the Suns expired, Channing opted out of it when the Orlando Magic Basketball team enticed him with an attractive four-year deal worth $32 million.

Wife, mother father and family facts

The talented parents of basketball player KarenMulzac-Frye and Thomas Frye are late. Frye’s mother died of cancer, but her father’s cause of death is not publicly known. The NBA player has a cousin in the prestigious league named Tobias Harris. Channing’s maternal grandfather, John Mulzac, was an active member of the Tuskegee Airmen.

See Also: Rudy Gobert Height, Weight, Parents, Girlfriend, NBA Career Profile

Entering the relationship status of the famous basketball player; Frye is married to Lauren Lisoski. The NBA player met his wife on his first day in Portland, just before the 2007-2008 NBA season. The couple, introduced by mutual friends, got along like a house on fire and barely two years after their first meeting, they tied the nuptial cord on August 14 precisely. Their wedding took place at Portland Garden Vineyards. a. The couple’s wedding was rumored on the street to feature a non-traditional wedding cake called a cake tree. At the time of their marriage, Channing was already playing for another team, the Phoenix Suns, and the couple had to move.

Frye’s wife, Lauren, is from the small town of Tualatin, Oregon. She attended Tualatin High School and had her college education at the University of Oregon.

They welcomed their first child, a boy named Hendrix on October 4, 2010. Their daughter Margaux was born visually impaired due to a cataract. The little girl was only able to see shadows and bright lights with only a 20% chance of regaining full vision. After undergoing five surgeries, she regained her vision before her second birthday.
